statements.statement: The government cannot be trusted to prioritize First Nations issues.
The Chiefs of the reserves cannot be trusted to handle the government's funding properly.
Safe clean drinkable water is a human right.
It is unconstitutional that First Nations people need to move off reserves to urban areas to access clean water.
Ignoring Firs Nations water quality issues devalues them as human beings.
As a developed country conditions of First Nations water quality are shameful.
First Nations people shouldn’t be given preferential treatment over other communities living with water quality issues.
A densely populated city would never have a 20 year boil advisory.
The First Nations people have sufficient access to potable water.
First Nations people don’t have the training/expertise to maintain the water treatment plants.
Simply chlorinating the water is not a sustainable solution.
We shouldn’t stand idly and watch this injustice remain unchallenged.
I personally do not see an issue with drinking bottled water.
Having to walk for long periods of time for drinkable water is emotionally and physically draining.
